entry.title: Shield Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 19.95 - 79.95 (5 variants)

Shield Blend (Thieves) is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Clove Bud, Lemon, Cinnamon Bark, Eucalyptus Radiata, and Rosemary. 

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿1 – 2 years

Max dilution: 0.45%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for a variety of skin issues including eczema, psoriasis, boils, pimples, warts, acne, athlete’s foot, and others.  It also helps fight signs of aging with powerful antioxidants and by improving elasticity.  It is an effective aid in a range respiratory issues from cough and congestion to bacterial and viral infections.  It also supports the immune system and aids digestion.  It will help prevent cuts and wounds from becoming infected as well as speed the healing process.  It is also great for dental health, allergies, cold sores, pain relief, insect bites and stings, and Lyme disease.  On top of all this, it can help ease stress and anxiety.

Around the house the oil can be used to sanitize, remove odors, purify the air, remove adhesives, and destroy mold.

Add a maximum of 1 drop (0.05 mL) to 10 mL of carrier oil (or 0.45%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin on desired area, wrists, neck, abdomen, or during massage.  Avoid freshly broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Shield Blend oil can cause CNS and breathing problems in young children, therefore, avoid use on or near the face of children under 2 years of age.  This oil can interact (through oral routes) with pethidine, MAOIs, indirect sympathomimetics, SSRIs, medications treating blood clotting, major surgery, peptic ulcer, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders.  Avoid using on diseased or damaged skin or if hypersensitive.  This oil may be oil may be embryotoxic and inhibit blood clotting.

This oil can be phototoxic and should not be used topically above concentrations of 6.8% on areas of skin that will be exposed to sunlight in the next 12 hours. 

Below are some potential drug interactions for Shield Blend.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Shield Blend essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate interaction:

  • Diabetes medications (Antidiabetic drugs) such as Amaryl, glyburide (DiaBeta, Glynase PresTab, Micronase), insulin, Actos, Avandia, Diabinese, Glucotrol, Orinase and others.
  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), and others.
  • Verteporfin – effectiveness is reduced.
  • MAOIs – Isocarboxazid (Marplan), Phenelzine (Nardil), Selegiline (Eldepryl, Emsam, Zelapar), Tranylcypromine (Parnate), and others.
  • SSRIs – citalopram (Celexa), escitalopram (Lexapro), fluoxetine (Sarafem, Prozac, Prozac Weekly, Selfemra, Rapiflux), fluvoxamine (Luvox, Luvox CR), paroxetine (Paxil, Paxil CR, Pexeva, Brisdelle), sertraline (Zoloft), and others.

Avoid old or oxidized Shield Blend oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 0.45%

This oil is not safe for children (2 years and under).

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Head Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 22.95 - 102.95 (5 variants)

Head Blend is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Peppermint, Lavender, Marjoram, Frankincense, Basil, German Chamomile, and Rosemary. 

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿2 – 3 years

Max dilution: 22%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for headaches, migraines, fatigue, and boosting memory.  It is also effective for supporting the immune system, PMS, sleep, stress, and anxiety.

Add a maximum of 22 drops (1.1 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 22%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin on wrists, neck, abdomen, or during massage.  Avoid broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Head Blend is choleretic, neurotoxic in high doses, and has a low risk of mucous membrane irritation.  Head Blend is contraindicated through all routes with cardiac fibrillation, G6PD deficiency, drugs metabolized by enzyme CYP2D6, and should not be applied on or near the face of infants or children.  Oral doses are contraindicated with cholestasis, drugs metabolized by enzymes CYP1A2, CYP2C9 or CYP3A4, and cautioned with GERD.  This oil can be harmful when oxidized and has a risk of sensitization.

Below are some possible drug interactions for Head Blend.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Head Blend essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate interaction:

  • Contraceptive drugs
  • Estrogens
  • Drugs metabolized by the liver such as Mevacor, Nizoral, Sporanox, Allegra, Halcion and many more.
  • Sedative medications (Benzodiazepines) such as Xanax, Klonopin, Valium, Ativan, Versed, Restoril, Halcion and others.
  • Sedative medications (CNS depressants) such as Nembutal, Luminal, Seconal, fentanyl (Duragesic, Sublimaze), Ambien and others.
  • Tamoxifen (Nolvadex)
  • Warfarin (Coumadin)

Minor interaction:

  • Medications changed by the liver such as Elavil, Haldol, Zofran, Inderal, theophylline (Theo-Dur, others), verapamil (Clanan, Isoptin, others) and many more.

Avoid old or oxidized Head Blend oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 6%

This oil should not be taken in oral doses.

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Joint Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 19.95 - 85.95 (5 variants)

Joint Blend is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Peppermint, Lavender, Juniper Berry, Wintergreen, and Vetiver.  

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿2 – 3 years

Max dilution: 6%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for the recovery of muscles and joints as well as the respiratory system.  It is also effective in recovering from mental fatigue, boosting concentration, easing stress and anxiety, and assisting with ADD and ADHD (see Safety and Warnings).

Add a maximum of 6 drops (0.3 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 6%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin over sore muscles or joints.  Avoid broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Joint Blend oil is choleretic, neurotoxic in high doses, has a low risk of mucous membrane irritation, inhibits blood clotting, can be toxic, and high doses are teratogenic.  Joint Blend oil is contraindicated through all routes with cardiac fibrillation, G6PD deficiency, anticoagulant medication, major surgery, hemophilia and other bleeding disorders, pregnancy, breastfeeding, children, and people with salicylate (aspirin) sensitivity (often applies in ADD/ADHD), and should not be applied on or near the face of infants or children.  Oral doses are contraindicated with cholestasis and GERD.  This oil can be harmful when oxidized and has a risk of sensitization.

Below are some possible drug interactions for Joint Blend.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Joint Blend essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Joint Blend oil can interact with anticoagulant medications.

Major interaction:

  • Warfarin (Coumadin)

Moderate interaction:

  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, and others.

Avoid old or oxidized Joint Blend oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

Avoid Joint Blend oil if you have an existing liver disease.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 6%

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Muscle Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 15.95 - 53.95 (5 variants)

Muscle Blend is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Peppermint, Lavender, Frankincense, Juniper Berry, Wintergreen, and Basil.  

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿2 – 3 years

Max dilution: 5.5%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for the recovery of muscles and joints as well as the respiratory system.  It is also effective in recovering from mental fatigue, boosting concentration, and easing stress and anxiety.

Add a maximum of 5 drops (0.25 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 5.5%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin over sore muscles or joints.  Avoid broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Muscle Blend oil is choleretic, neurotoxic in high doses, has a low risk of mucous membrane irritation, inhibits blood clotting, can be toxic, and high doses are teratogenic.  Muscle Blend oil is contraindicated through all routes with cardiac fibrillation, G6PD deficiency, anticoagulant medication, major surgery, hemophilia and other bleeding disorders, pregnancy, breastfeeding, children, and people with salicylate (aspirin) sensitivity (often applies in ADD/ADHD), and should not be applied on or near the face of infants or children.  Oral doses are contraindicated with cholestasis and GERD.  This oil can be harmful when oxidized and has a risk of sensitization.

Below are some possible drug interactions for Muscle Blend.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Muscle Blend essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Muscle blend oil can interact with anticoagulant medications.

Major interaction:

  • Warfarin (Coumadin)

Moderate interaction:

  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, and others.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 5.5%

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Cleanse
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 18.95 - 79.95 (5 variants)

Cleanse is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Pink Grapefruit, Lemon, Geranium, Fennel, and Juniper. 

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿1 – 2 years

Max dilution: 5%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for stress, anxiety, supporting the immune system, detoxifying, sore muscles or joints, and as a digestive aid.  It is also effective for boosting circulation, balancing mood, PMS/menopause, and respiratory issues.

Add a maximum of 5 drops (0.25 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 5%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin on wrists, neck, abdomen, or during massage.  Avoid broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Cleanse is potentially carcinogenic, estrogenic, and may interact with some medications.  May reduce blood clotting.  Avoid Cleanse oil for 2 weeks before major surgery.  Contraindicated by all routes with pregnancy, breastfeeding, endometriosis, estrogen-dependent cancers, and children under 5 years of age.  Contraindicated orally with diabetes medication, anticoagulant drugs, major surgery, peptic ulcers, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders.

This oil can be phototoxic and should not be used topically above concentrations of 10% on areas of skin that will be exposed to sunlight in the next 12 hours.  This oil can be harmful when oxidized and has a risk of sensitization.

Cleanse can interact with anti-diabetic medications (through oral routes) and drugs metabolized by CYP2B6 (through all routes).

Moderate interaction:

  • Ketamine
  • Efavirenz (Sustiva and others)
  • Bupropion (Wellbutrin, Zyban and others)
  • Cyclophosphamide (cytophosphane and others)
  • Ifosfamide (Ifex and others)
  • Methadone (Dolophine, Methadose and others)
  • MDMA (ecstasy and others)
  • Thiotepa

Minor interaction:

  • Nicotine

Avoid old or oxidized Cleanse oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 5%

This oil is not safe for children.

Cleanse is potentially estrogenic.

Avoid Cleanse for 2 weeks before undergoing anesthesia or surgery.

Avoid Cleanse oil if you have an existing liver disease.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Harmony
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 16.95 - 143.95 (6 variants)

Harmony is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Lavender, Frankincense, Geranium, German Chamomile, Wintergreen, and Ylang Ylang. 

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿2 – 3 years

Max dilution: 4.8%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for skin issues, healing scars, stress, anxiety, supporting the immune system, and sore muscles or joints.  It is also effective for boosting circulation, balancing mood, PMS/menopause, and sleep.

Add a maximum of 5 drops (0.25 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 4.8%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin on wrists, neck, abdomen, or during massage.  Avoid broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Harmony oil inhibits blood clotting, can be toxic, and high doses are teratogenic.  Harmony oil is contraindicated through all routes with drugs metabolized by enzyme CYP2D6, anticoagulant medication, major surgery, hemophilia and other bleeding disorders, pregnancy, breastfeeding, children, and people with salicylate (aspirin) sensitivity (often applies in ADD/ADHD).  Oral doses are contraindicated with drugs metabolized by enzymes CYP1A2, CYP2C9 or CYP3A4, and GERD.  This oil can be harmful when oxidized and has a risk of sensitization.

Below are some possible drug interactions for Harmony.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Wintergreen essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Harmony oil interacts with anticoagulant medications (through all routes), anti-diabetic medications (through oral routes) and drugs metabolized by CYP2B6 (through all routes).

Major interaction:

  • Warfarin (Coumadin)

Moderate interaction:

  • Contraceptive drugs
  • Estrogens
  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, and others.
  • Sedative medications (Benzodiazepines) such as Xanax, Klonopin, Valium, Ativan, Versed, Restoril, Halcion and others.
  • Sedative medications (CNS depressants) such as Nembutal, Luminal, Seconal, fentanyl (Duragesic, Sublimaze), Ambien and others.
  • Tamoxifen (Nolvadex)
  • Ketamine
  • Efavirenz (Sustiva and others)
  • Bupropion (Wellbutrin, Zyban and others)
  • Cyclophosphamide (cytophosphane and others)
  • Ifosfamide (Ifex and others)
  • Methadone (Dolophine, Methadose and others)
  • MDMA (ecstasy and others)
  • Thiotepa
  • Drugs metabolized by the liver such as Mevacor, Nizoral, Sporanox, Allegra, Halcion and many more.

Minor interaction:

  • Nicotine
  • Medications changed by the liver such as Elavil, Haldol, Zofran, Inderal, theophylline (Theo-Dur, others), verapamil (Clanan, Isoptin, others) and many more.

Avoid old or oxidized Harmony oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 4.8%

This oil should not be taken in oral doses.

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Perfect Balance
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 16.95 - 141.95 (6 variants)

Perfect Balance is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Pink Grapefruit, Lemon, Patchouli, Ylang Ylang, and Sandalwood. 

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿1 – 2 years

Max dilution: 4.4%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is safe for children.

This blend is great for skin issues, healing scars, stress, anxiety, supporting the immune system, sore muscles or joints, and as a digestive aid.  It is also effective for boosting circulation, balancing mood, respiratory issues, sleep, and as a mild aphrodisiac.

Add a maximum of 4 drops (0.2 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 4.4%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin on wrists, neck, abdomen, or during massage.  Avoid broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Perfect Balance may inhibit blood clotting.  Oral use is contraindicated with anticoagulant medication, major surgery, peptic ulcers, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders. 

This oil can be phototoxic and should not be used topically above concentrations of 7.3% on areas of skin that will be exposed to sunlight in the next 12 hours.  This oil can be harmful when oxidized and has a risk of sensitization.

Below are some of the possible drug interactions for Perfect Balance.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Perfect Balance essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate interaction:

  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), and others.

A constituent in Perfect Balance (a-bisabolol) inhibits CYP2D6.  The following drugs may interact when Perfect balance oil is taken orally:

  • Analgesic including codeine, hydrocodone, oxycodone, phenacetin, tramadol
  • Anesthetics including lidocaine
  • Anorectics including dexfenfluramine
  • Antiemetic/Prokinetics including metoclopramide, ondansetron
  • Antihistamines including chlorpheniramine, promethazine
  • Antineoplastics including tamoxifen
  • Cardiovascular meds including alprenolol, carvedilol, clonidine, debrisoquine, diltiazem, disopyramide, flecainide, S-metoprolol, mexiletine, nebivolol, perhexiline, propafenone, propranolol, sparteine, timolol
  • Cholinesterase inhibitors including donepezil
  • Cough suppressants including dextromethorphan
  • Psychotropics including amitriptyline, amphetamine, aripiprazole, atomoxetine, chlorpromazine, clomipramine, desipramine, duloxetine, fluoxetine, fluvoxamine, haloperidol, iloperidone, imipramine, methamphetamine, methoxyamphetamine, minaprine, nortriptyline, paroxetine, perphenazine, pimozide, risperidone, sertraline, thioridazine, venlafaxine, zuclopenthixol

Avoid old or oxidized Perfect Balance oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 4.4%

This oil is safe for children.

Avoid for 2 weeks before surgery.
